intro: Chiropetalum berteroanum f. macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered chiropetalum, is a unique variant of the chiropetalum genus. It is characterized by its notably larger and more showy flowers compared to the typical species. The plant belongs to the Melastomataceae family, which includes many tropical flowering plants. Its botanical features include opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth surface and a compact, shrub-like growth habit. This form is often found in moist, shaded environments within its native range in South America.
